intro: [WRONG START] McNeillia pseudosaxifraga, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions. McNeillia pseudosaxifraga is often found in crevices or on slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
